page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY ASHBY MAGNA
page.content: In the original Doomsday Book Ashby Magna was known as Essebi Magna. The parish church of St. Mary's is on the southern edge of the village near a moated site from which the village may have developed. Behind the church is a field in which can be seen the indentations of medieval carp ponds. The old railway station closed on 5th May l969 is now used as a timber contractors yard The school building built in l8l6 was purchased from the church commissioners in l978 by the villagers and now used as the village hall. Past trades included a butcher, a schoolmistress, a tailor, shoemaker, baker, gardener and a blacksmith, the old forge building can still be seen in Old Forge Road.
